meganorm.datasets.CMI.load_CMI_data(feature_path, covariates_path)[source]

Load CMI dataset

Parameters:

  • feature_path (str) – Path to the the feature csv file.

  • covariates_path (str) – path to the covariates tsv file.

Returns:

Pandas dataframe with CMI covariates and features.

Return type:

DataFrame

meganorm.datasets.CMI.load_covariates_CMI(base_path: str, save_dir: str)[source]

This info loads all files containing age, gender, diagnosis and site for CMI dataset”

Parameters:

path (str) – path to covariates.

Returns:

Pandas dataframe containing age, gender, site and diagnosis for CMI dataset.

Return type:

DataFrame

meganorm.datasets.CMI.mne_bids_CMI(input_base_path, output_base_path, montage_path)[source]

This code converges the CMI dataset into BIDS format. Meanwhile, it defines channels on nek and chin as misc channels and channels around the eyes as eog channels

meganorm.datasets.MIPDB module

meganorm.datasets.MIPDB.mne_bids_MIPDB(input_base_path, output_base_path, montage_path)[source]

This code converges the MIPDB csv files into an mne raw object and then into BIDS format.

meganorm.datasets.MIPDB.preprocess_events_file(file_path)[source]

Preprocesses the events CSV file to remove repeated headers but keeps the first header.

meganorm.datasets.hcp module

meganorm.datasets.mne_bids_conversion module

meganorm.datasets.mne_bids_conversion.make_demo_file_bids(file_dir: str, save_dir: str, id_col: int, age_col: int, *argv) → None[source]

This function read demographic data and convert them to a common template so can be used later in processing.

Parameters:

  • file_dir (str) – Path to the input demographic file (e.g., CSV).

  • save_dir (str) – Directory where the BIDS-formatted file should be saved.

  • id_col (int) – Column index for the participant ID.

  • age_col (int) – Column index for the age.

  • argv (dict)

Returns:

None
